verses.verse: But now they that are younger<WH6810> than I have me in derision<WH7832>, Whose fathers<WH1> I disdained<WH3988> to set<WH7896> with the dogs<WH3611> of my flock<WH6629>.
Yea <WH3581>, the strength of their hands<WH3027>, whereto<WH4100> should it profit me<WH3624>? Men in whom ripe age is perished<WH6>.
They are gaunt<WH1565> with want<WH2639> and famine<WH3720>; They gnaw<WH6207> the dry ground<WH6723>, in the gloom<WH570> of wasteness<WH4875> and desolation<WH7722>.
They pluck<WH6998> salt-wort<WH4408> by the bushes<WH7880>; And the roots<WH8328> of the broom<WH7574> are their food<WH3899>.
They are driven forth<WH1644> from the midst<WH1460> of men<WH7321>; They cry after them as after a thief<WH1590>;
So that they dwell<WH7931> in frightful<WH6178> valleys<WH5158>, In holes<WH2356> of the earth<WH6083> and of the rocks<WH3710>.
Among the bushes<WH7880> they bray<WH5101>; Under the nettles<WH2738> they are gathered together<WH5596>.
They are children<WH1121> of fools<WH5036>, yea<WH1121>, children of base men<WH8034>; They were scourged<WH5217> out of the land<WH776>.
And now I am become their song<WH5058>, Yea<WH4405>, I am a byword unto them.
They abhor<WH8581> me<WH7368>, they stand aloof from me<WH2820>, And spare not to spit<WH7536> in my face<WH6440>.
For he hath loosed<WH6605> his cord<WH3499>, and afflicted<WH6031> me<WH7971>; And they have cast off the bridle<WH7448> before me<WH6440>.
Upon my right<WH3225> hand rise<WH6965> the rabble<WH6526>; They thrust aside<WH7971> my feet<WH7272>, And they cast up<WH5549> against me their ways<WH734> of destruction<WH343>.
They mar<WH5420> my path<WH5410>, They set forward<WH3276> my calamity<WH1942>, Even men that have no helper<WH5826>.
As through a wide<WH7342> breach<WH6556> they come<WH857>: In the midst<WH8478> of the ruin<WH7722> they roll themselves upon me<WH1556>.
Terrors <WH1091> are turned<WH2015> upon me<WH7291>; They chase mine honor<WH5082> as the wind<WH7307>; And my welfare<WH3444> is passed away<WH5674> as a cloud<WH5645>.
And now my soul<WH5315> is poured out<WH8210> within me<WH3117>; Days of affliction<WH6040> have taken hold upon me<WH270>.
In the night season<WH3915> my bones<WH6106> are pierced<WH5365> in me<WH6207>, And the pains that gnaw me take no rest<WH7901>.
By God<WH7230>'s great force<WH3581> is my garment<WH3830> disfigured<WH2664>; It bindeth me about<WH247> as the collar<WH6310> of my coat<WH3801>.
He hath cast<WH3384> me into the mire<WH2563>, And I am become like<WH4911> dust<WH6083> and ashes<WH665>.
I cry<WH7768> unto thee<WH6030>, and thou dost not answer me<WH5975>: I stand up, and thou gazest at me<WH995>.
Thou art turned<WH2015> to be cruel<WH393> to me<WH6108>; With the might of thy hand<WH3027> thou persecutest me<WH7852>.
Thou liftest me up<WH5375> to the wind<WH7307>, thou causest me to ride<WH7392> upon it<WH4127>; And thou dissolvest me in the storm<WH8454>.
For I know<WH3045> that thou wilt bring<WH7725> me to death<WH4194>, And to the house<WH1004> appointed<WH4150> for all living<WH2416>.
Howbeit doth not one stretch out<WH7971> the hand<WH3027> in his fall<WH1164>? Or in his calamity<WH6365> therefore cry for help<WH7769>?
Did not I weep<WH1058> for him that was in trouble<WH7186>? Was not my soul<WH5315> grieved<WH5701> for the needy<WH34>?
When I looked<WH6960> for good<WH2896>, then evil<WH7451> came<WH935>; And when I waited<WH3176> for light<WH216>, there came<WH935> darkness<WH652>.
My heart<WH4578> is troubled<WH7570>, and resteth<WH1826> not<WH3117>; Days of affliction<WH6040> are come upon me<WH6923>.
I go<WH1980> mourning<WH6937> without the sun<WH2535>: I stand up<WH6965> in the assembly<WH6951>, and cry for help<WH7768>.
I am a brother<WH251> to jackals<WH8577>, And a companion<WH7453> to ostriches<WH1323>.
My skin<WH5785> is black<WH7835>, and falleth from me<WH6106>, And my bones are burned<WH2787> with heat<WH2721>.
Therefore is my harp<WH3658> turned to mourning<WH60>, And my pipe<WH5748> into the voice<WH6963> of them that weep<WH1058>.
